name: logrncn

stmt.origin: simp1bi(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))
stmt.pretty: simp1bi(c0 ∈ ran(log), c0 ∈ ℂ, -u(π)[<](Im ` c0), (Im ` c0)[≤]π)

|- wi(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c0, cc))
-| wb(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)))

comment: The range of the natural logarithm function is a subset of the complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-May-2014.)
